alert.note: Alert for Western Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN PASSAIC AND CENTRAL ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms moving north at 45 mph and approaching the area. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middletown, West Milford, Port Jervis, Warwick, Goshen, Howells, Chester, Greenwood Lake, Florida, Cuddebackville, Otisville, Huguenot, Unionville, Upper Greenwood Lake, and Scotchtown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for northeastern New Jersey...and southeastern New York.
